means: Linear Energy Transfer 能量线性传递
Lettish 列托人的，列托语的，列托语（拉脱维亚）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"让，允许"之意。
means: allow ：普通用词，侧重听任、默许或不加阻止。在正式场合可用来表客气的请求。
let ：常用词，用于各种非正式场合，语气最弱，指允许或无力阻止某事，暗示漠不关心或听之任之。
permit ：正式用词，在多数场合可与allow换用，语义最强，指准许某人做某事，含权威或正式的意味。
authorize ：语气最强，指权威性的允许与认可。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"租，租用"之意。
means: hire ： 多指短期租用。在英国一般指租用车、船。
lease ： 指按照租约租出或租用房屋、土地或其它不动产。
rent ： 在英国指较长时间租出或租入房屋、商店或土地；而在美国指长时间或短时期租用各种资产以及日用东西。
let ： 尤指出租房屋或地产等。
charter ： 指承租大型运输工具，如飞机、轮船、大客车以及火车等。

sentence.Network_en: Well, at any rate, let me thank you for all you did.
sentence.Network_cn: 好吧，不管怎样，还是要感谢你所做的一切。

sentence.Network_en: I let the horse drop his head to crop the spring grass.
sentence.Network_cn: 我让马低下头啃吃春天的青草。

sentence.Network_en: If they value these data, let them pay for them.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 人教版七年级上册英语单词表 ... bat n. 球拍（乒乓球等的） let v. 允许；让 play v. 玩；打（球）.
出字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 出走〖 leave;flee〗 出租〖 rent;hire;let〗 出租汽车〖 taxi,taxicab〗.
破擦音_百度百科 ... beds /bedz/ 床(复) let's /lets/ 让我们 what's /wɔts/ 什么.
人教版初一上册英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... why adv. 为什么 let v. 让；假设 time n. 时间；时代；次数.

list.abs: 大学英语四级常用词组 ... let alone 不干涉；不碰 let down 放下；降低；使…失望 let go 放开；释放；发射.
高中英语新课程标准词汇表 ... let in 让……进来，放进 let out 放掉, 泄露 live on 以……为主食，靠……为生.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... let off 放(炮)；开(枪)；宽恕 let out 放掉(水等)，发出 let up 减小；(雨等)渐渐停止.
我的博客 - 王者天下 - 网易博客 ... 2. I quit! 我不干了! 3. Let go! 放手! 5. My god! 天哪.
Let - 搜搜百科 ... leave/let sth alone 不碰；不变动；不移动 let alone 更不用说 leave/let sb/sth be 随…去；不打扰某人╱某事.

jx.jx_en_mean: To cause to come down gradually; lower
jx.jx_cn_mean: 放下，降下：使其逐渐下来；降低

jx.jx_en_mean: To withdraw support from; forsake.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使失望：没有达到所期望的；使沮丧

jx.jx_en_mean: To allow to be known; admit

lj.lj_ly: Don't let on that you know me.
lj.lj_ls: 不要让人知道你认识我

jx.jx_en_mean: To pretend.
To come to a close; end

lj.lj_ly: School let out early. The play let out at 11&b{p.m.}
lj.lj_ls: 学校放学早。话剧&b{晚上} 11点结束

jx.jx_en_mean: To make known; reveal
To increase the size of (a garment, for example)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 放大（衣服）：增大（例如衣服的）尺寸

jx.jx_en_mean: To slow down; diminish

lj.lj_ly: didn't let up in their efforts.

jx.jx_en_mean: To come to a stop; cease
stop disturbing or interfering with

lj.lj_ly: let him be—he knows what he wants.
lj.lj_ls: 随他去吧——他知道自己要做什么。

jx.jx_en_mean: seek to give someone bad news in a way that avoids causing them too much distress or humiliation
casually reveal a piece of information
jx.jx_cn_mean: 无意中说出，不经意透露

lj.lj_ly: from the things he let drop I think there was a woman in his life.
lj.lj_ls: 从他随口说出的话里，我听出他身边有一个女人。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Geometry)draw (a perpendicular) from an outside point to a line
attack, either physically or verbally
jx.jx_cn_mean: 对…进行（身体或语言）攻击

lj.lj_ly: the troops let fly with shells loaded with chemical weapons.
lj.lj_ls: 军队用化学武器炮弹进行攻击。

jx.jx_en_mean: act in an unrestrained or uninhibited way

lj.lj_ly: you need to unwind and let yourself go.
lj.lj_ls: 你该放松下来，干点自己想干的事。

jx.jx_en_mean: become careless or untidy in one's habits or appearance

lj.lj_ly: he's really let himself go since my mother died.
lj.lj_ls: 自从妈妈去世之后，他变得越来越邋遢。

jx.jx_en_mean: allow someone or something to escape or go free
(亦作 let go 或 let go of)relinquish one's grip on someone or something

lj.lj_ly: Adam let go of the reins.
you must let the past go.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)attack someone physically or verbally

lj.lj_ly: I really let him have it for worrying me so much.
lj.lj_ls: 他老是烦我，我好好教训了他一顿。

jx.jx_en_mean: engage (or release) the clutch of a vehicle by releasing pressure on (or applying it to) the clutch pedal

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English lǣtan 'leave behind, leave out', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch laten and German lassen, also to late
Old English lettan 'hinder', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch letten, also to late

entry.def: If you let something happen, you allow it to happen without doing anything to stop or prevent it.

example.ex: People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals die...
example.tran: 人们说我们是在干涉自然界，还说我们应该任由动物死去。

example.ex: Thorne let him talk...
example.tran: 索恩让他畅所欲言。

entry.tran: 允许，准许，同意（某人做某事）
entry.def: If you let someone do something, you give them your permission to do it.

example.ex: I love sweets but Mum doesn't let me have them very often...
example.tran: 我爱吃糖，可妈妈不让我常吃。

example.ex: The Americans won't let her leave the country...
example.tran: 美国人不允许她出境。

entry.tran: （开门、让路等）允许（…进、出或通过）
entry.def: If you let someone into, out of, or through a place, you allow them to enter, leave, or go through it, for example by opening a door or making room for them.

example.ex: I had to get up at seven o'clock this morning to let them into the building because they had lost their keys...
example.tran: 今天早上我不得不7点钟就起床开门让他们进楼，因为他们把钥匙弄丢了。

example.ex: I let myself into the flat...
example.tran: 我自己开门进了公寓。

entry.tran: （用于引出要说的话）让我，我来
entry.def: You use let me when you are introducing something you want to say.

example.ex: Let me say it again. I despised Wade's life...
example.tran: 我再说一遍。我厌恶韦德的生活方式。

example.ex: Let me tell you what I saw last night...
example.tran: 我来告诉你我昨晚见到了什么。

entry.tran: （用于礼貌地表示愿意提供帮助）让我，我来
entry.def: You use let me when you are offering politely to do something.

example.ex: Let me take your coat...
example.tran: 我来帮您拿外套。

example.ex: Let me get you something to drink.
example.tran: 我给你拿杯喝的来。

entry.tran: （用于将他人的注意力引向下面的话题）让我们
entry.def: You say let's or, in more formal English, let us, to direct the attention of the people you are talking to towards the subject that you want to consider next.

example.ex: Let's consider ways of making it easier...
example.tran: 咱们来想想办法把它变得更容易些吧。

example.ex: Let us look at these views in more detail.
example.tran: 我们来具体研究一下这些观点。

entry.tran: （用于提出建议或表示赞同）让我们
entry.def: You say let's  or, in formal English, let us, when you are making a suggestion that involves both you and the person you are talking to, or when you are agreeing to a suggestion of this kind.

example.ex: I'm bored. Let's go home...
example.tran: 我觉得好无聊。我们回家吧。

example.ex: 'Shall we go in and have some supper?' — 'Yes, let's.'
example.tran: “我们要不要进去吃点晚饭？”——“好啊，走吧。”

entry.tran: （用于委婉地发出指令）让我们
entry.def: Someone in authority, such as a teacher, can use let's or, in more formal English, let us, in order to give a polite instruction to another person or group of people.

example.ex: Let's have some hush, please...
example.tran: 请大家安静一下。

example.ex: 'Let us pray,' said the Methodist chaplain.
example.tran: “我们来祈祷吧，”那个循道宗牧师说。

entry.tran: （表示犹豫或思考）让我看看/让我想想
entry.def: People often use let in expressions such as let me see or let me think when they are hesitating or thinking of what to say next.

example.ex: Now, let's see. Where did I leave my bag?...
example.tran: 嗯，我想想。我把包放哪儿了？

example.ex: 'How long you been living together then?' — 'Erm, let me think. It's about four years now.'
example.tran: “那你们住在一起有多久了？”——“呃，我想想。到现在差不多4年了。”

entry.def: You can use let to say that you do not care if someone does something, although you think it is unpleasant or wrong.

example.ex: If he wants to do that, let him do it...
example.tran: 他要做，就让他做好了。

example.ex: Let them talk about me; I'll be dead, anyway...
example.tran: 随他们怎么说我吧；我反正是要死的。

entry.tran: （表示认为某人应该做某事）让
entry.def: You can use let when you are saying what you think someone should do, usually when they are behaving in a way that you think is unreasonable or wrong.

example.ex: Let him get his own cup of tea...
example.tran: 自己的茶让他自己端。

example.ex: If they value these data, let them pay for them.
example.tran: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。

entry.def: You can use let when you are praying or hoping very much that something will happen.

example.ex: Please God, let him telephone me.
example.tran: 上帝啊，求你让他打电话给我吧。

entry.def: You can use let to introduce an assumption on which you are going to base a theory, calculation, or story.

example.ex: Let x equal 5 and y equal 3...
example.tran: 设x等于5，y等于3。

example.ex: The new man in my life (let's call him Dave) had a very jealous ex-girlfriend.
example.tran: 我生命中这个新男人（就叫他戴夫吧），他的前女友是个醋坛子。

entry.def: If you let your house or land to someone, you allow them to use it in exchange for money that they pay you regularly.

example.ex: She is thinking of letting her house to an American serviceman...
example.tran: 她正考虑把房子租给一个美国军人。

example.ex: The reasons for letting a house, or part of one, are varied.
example.tran: 把整套房子或其中一部分租出去，其原因是多种多样的。

entry.tran: （网球或羽毛球发球时的）擦网球，触网重发
entry.def: In tennis or badminton, if you serve a let, the ball or shuttlecock touches the net but lands in the correct part of the court. You then serve again.

entry.tran: （通常用在否定句后）遑论，更别提，更不用说
entry.def: Let alone is used after a statement, usually a negative one, to indicate that the statement is even more true of the person, thing, or situation that you are going to mention next.

example.ex: It is incredible that the 12-year-old managed to even reach the pedals, let alone drive the car.
example.tran: 12岁的孩子能踩到踏板已经是不可思议，就更不用说开车了。

entry.def: To let someone be means to leave them alone and not interfere in what they are doing.

example.ex: If your child is really sick and needs sleep and quiet, let him be.
example.tran: 如果孩子真的病了，需要睡眠和静养的话，就不要去打扰他。

entry.def: If you let go of someone or something, you stop holding them.

example.ex: She let go of Mona's hand and took a sip of her drink...
example.tran: 她放开莫娜的手，抿了一口饮料。

example.ex: She held the photos with the determined grip of a small child and wouldn't  let go.
example.tran: 她像小孩一样紧紧攥住那些照片，不肯放手。

entry.tran: 放弃，舍弃（感情、态度、控制权）
entry.def: If you let go of a feeling, attitude, or the control that you have over something, you accept that you should give it up or that it should no longer influence you.

example.ex: In therapy, she began to let go of her obsession with Mike...
example.tran: 在心理治疗中，她开始逐渐放下对麦克的痴迷。

example.ex: The work should focus on helping parents to let go of their children.
example.tran: 工作应以协助父母放松对子女的管教为重点。

entry.def: If you let someone or something go, you allow them to leave or escape.

example.ex: They held him for three hours and they let him go...
example.tran: 他们扣留了他3个小时后放走了他。

example.ex: I'm quite happy really to net a fish and then let it go.
example.tran: 网到鱼后又把它放生，我挺开心的。

entry.def: When someone leaves a job, either because they are told to or because they want to, the employer sometimes says that they are letting that person go .

example.ex: I've assured him I have no plans to let him go...
example.tran: 我向他保证，我绝对没打算让他走人。

example.ex: Peterson was let go after less than two years.
example.tran: 不到两年彼得森就被解雇了。

entry.def: If someone says or does something that you think is annoying or stupid and you let it go, you do not react to it or say anything about it.

example.ex: Let it go, he thought. He didn't feel like arguing.
example.tran: 管它呢，他想。他并不想争吵。

entry.def: If you let yourself go, you relax and behave much more freely than usual.

example.ex: Stop worrying about what you're feeling. Let yourself go.
example.tran: 不要总想着自己是什么感觉。放轻松点。

entry.def: If someone lets themselves go, they pay less attention to themselves or their appearance than they used to, so that they look untidy or unattractive.

example.ex: If you have let yourself go, you should consider doing something about it for the sake of your health.
example.tran: 你以前要是对自己不管不顾，现在应该为了自己的健康着想而改变一下。

entry.tran: (使自己)陷入，卷入，招惹（麻烦等）
entry.def: If you say that you did not know what you were letting yourself in for when you decided to do something, you mean you did not realize how difficult, unpleasant, or expensive it was going to be.

example.ex: He got the impression that Miss Hawes had no idea of what she was letting herself in for...
example.tran: 他觉得霍斯小姐根本不知道自己会惹来什么麻烦。

example.ex: I realized I'd let myself in for something from which there was no turning back.
example.tran: 我意识到自己陷入了没有退路的境地。

entry.def: If you let someone know something, you tell them about it or make sure that they know about it.

example.ex: They want to let them know that they are safe...
example.tran: 他们想让他们知道他们安全无事。

example.ex: If you do want to go, please let me know.
example.tran: 如果你真想去的话就请告诉我。

entry.def: If you let drop ,let fall, or let slip information, you reveal it casually or by accident, during a conversation about something else.

example.ex: How could she know about that? He'd certainly never let drop any hint...
example.tran: 她是怎么知道的？他绝对没有走漏半点风声。

example.ex: He might have let something slip in a moment of weakness.
example.tran: 他可能一时大意说漏了嘴。

entry.def: If you say that someone has been let loose in a place or situation, you mean that they have been given complete freedom to do what they like in that place or situation, and you suggest that this may be risky.

example.ex: She has all the glee of a little girl let loose in a sweetie shop...
example.tran: 她像糖果店里无人管束的小女孩那样兴高采烈。

example.ex: Trainees go through a four-hour lesson before they are let loose on the controls.
example.tran: 受训人员须上4小时的课才能自由进行操作。

entry.def: If someone lets loose a sound or remark, they make it, often suddenly.

example.ex: He let loose a long, deep sigh...
example.tran: 他突然喟然长叹了一声。

example.ex: Hill let loose a torrent of abuse against those who prosecuted his case.
example.tran: 希尔对控告他的人破口大骂起来。

entry.tran: 使美中不足；使差强人意；使不理想
entry.def: If something lets you down, it is the reason you are not as successful as you could have been.

example.ex: Many believe it was his shyness and insecurity which let him down...
example.tran: 很多人认为是他的腼腆和缺乏安全感拖了他的后腿。

example.ex: Sadly, the film is let down by an excessively simple plot.
example.tran: 遗憾的是，过于简单的情节使得这部电影差强人意。

entry.def: If you let down something such as a tyre, you allow air to escape from it.

example.ex: I let the tyres down on his car...
example.tran: 我把他的汽车轮胎放了气。

example.ex: Remove wheelnuts, let down tyre, put on spare.
example.tran: 拧下车轮螺母，放掉车胎的气，换上备用胎。

means.word_mean: 1. a serve that strikes the net before falling into the receiver's court; the ball must be served again
1. make it possible through a specific action or lack of action for something to happen;

sentences.sentence: "This permits the water to rush in"
"This sealed door won't allow the water come into the basement"
"This will permit the rain to run off"
"I let it be known that I was not interested"
"She permitted her son to visit her estranged husband"
"I won't let the police search her basement"
"I cannot allow you to see your exam"

means.word_mean: 4. cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He got his squad on the ball"
"This let me in for a big surprise"

means.word_mean: 6. grant use or occupation of under a term of contract;

sentences.sentence: "I am leasing my country estate to some foreigners"

auth_sentence.content: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's wait for next week's Republican convention.

auth_sentence.content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!

auth_sentence.content: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's hear what Shawn is looking forward to.

sentences.en: They let fly a shower of arrows.
His father doesn't let him smoke.
We mustn't let slip such an opportunity.
sentences.cn: 这样的机会我们不能错过。

means.word_mean: 让…经过(或来、去)；允许…通过

sentences.en: The secretary let me into the office.
Let the water from the tank.
We're hoping to let this field.
sentences.cn: 我们希望把这块地租出去。

sentences.en: Mrs. Brown let me a room.
sentences.cn: 布朗夫人租给我一间房。

sentences.en: They let rooms to college students.
sentences.cn: 他们向大学生出租房间。

jushi.english: The house lets for 50 dollars a month.
jushi.chinese: 这房子出租,租金一个月50美元。

jushi.english: The house does not let well.
The farmers near cities are working part of their land themselves and are letting the rest.
jushi.chinese: 城市附近的农民自己耕种一部分土地,出租其余的部分。
